p.s: In my opinion Shakespeare is still relevant.
Even if you do not notice, Shakespeare is nearly everywhere in our daily life.
Starting from our language two books and films and even more.
Shakespeare's presence in the modern English language is undeniable over 1700 words have been invented by the poet.
Metaphors like break the ice or killing with kindness are still common in every book and even in famous pop songs like Killing with kindness by Selena Gomez.
Moreover there is a wealth of adaptions of Shakespeare's plays in writing and film, which require in a lot of cases the knowledge of Shakespeare's works.
Shakespeare it's like a big inside in our society.
Generally speaking to understand modern work, it is helpful to understand Shakespeare.
The reason for the never ending presence of Shakespeare is his talent for the use of words.
He describes complex feelings and situations with imagerysimageries that only contain a few words and lead to an easy understanding of difficult topics.
For instance the metaphor breaking the ice.
However there is one central problem with Shakespeare's plays and poems.
They were all written 400 years ago in early modern English.
For that reason must students struggle with his pieces and tend to avoid them.
Because of the difficult language it is hard to understand the message of Shakespeare's words.
But I think that especially the poems do not a great knowledge of early modern English.
Just a few words like thee and thy can help to understand dishonored and unknown words can easily be looked up in for instance dictionaries.
Of course this method does not work that well for dramas, but if teachers support their students well, they should be able to get the main idea of the plays.
The main problem is maybe not Shakespeare itself, but the rare contact with the lyric and drama of todaystoday's youth.
We are surrounded by narrative texts which leadsleads us to focus on the content of texts.
But poems and dramas focus on what is written between the verses.
Thus the purpose of poems is not clear and Shakespeare, who uses tons of imagery, can notcannot be understood.
It is important to teach studentswhat they have to look for in poems and dramas and that poetry is a way to express feelings, attitudes and situations with the power of words.
The best example to teach this is Shakespeare.
Because even though the englishEnglish language has developed, the themes of Shakespeare's plays have remained relevant up to this day.
As well as his poems that deal with timeless topics like love, the passing of time and death.
Therefore it is not difficult to understand what Shakespeare describes once you know what to look for.
In conclusion early modern englishEnglish is hard to understand and can create barriers to Shakespeare's works.
But once you overcome this difficulty with the help of dictionaries and teachers, a door opens for you and gives you a glance of what an impact the power of words can have on you and the whole world.
